summary: The No More Missing Children Act establishes the Unaccompanied Alien Child Anti-Trafficking Program. This program, administered by the Secretary of Health and Human Services (in coordination with Homeland Security), aims to prevent the trafficking and disappearance of unaccompanied alien children. It mandates sponsor vetting, including background checks, biometric data collection, GPS monitoring, telephonic reporting, and home visits. The bill outlines sponsor eligibility criteria, the consequences of failing to comply with release conditions, and defines key terms related to the program.
